intro: Anthospermum prittwitzii, commonly known as the Indian sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, succulent leaves. The plant produces tiny, white or pale blue flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. Its botanical features make it well adapted to survive in harsh environmental conditions.
